definition: to slip sb sth/to press sb to accept sth/to insert surreptitiously/to foist sth off on sb
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: Before departure, running Tian Juhua to iron tiger a pair of new shoes.
sentences.chinese: 出發前，田菊華跑來，塞給鐵虎一雙新鞋。

sentences.english: If you slipped the doorman $10 he'll let you in.
sentences.chinese: 你如果悄悄塞給門童十美元，他就會讓你進去。

sentences.english: He shouldn't palm such stuff on you.
sentences.chinese: 他不應該把這樣的東西塞給你。

sentences.english: His coins all slotted into the slot machine.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的硬幣塞給了老虎機。

sentences.english: An alarm clock is something built with a mechanism to scare the daylight into you.
sentences.chinese: 鬧鐘是嚇你一跳，然後把白天塞給你的一種機械。

sentences.english: The witness was fed with the money to say nothing about what he saw.
sentences.chinese: 有人塞給目擊者錢，讓對所見的事保持沉默。

sentences.english: And he picked a handful of pine nuts, slipped down, and gave them to her.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥便採了一大把松子溜下來塞給她。

sentences.english: Do not accept the roles that society foists on you.
sentences.chinese: 不要接受社會悄悄塞給你的角色。

sentences.english: Red slips Youngblood six packs of cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德塞給楊伯拉德六包香菸。

sentences.english: that will be a lot more successful than trying to cram a lot of vocabulary words right away.
sentences.chinese: 那樣會比一下子塞給自己很多單詞要好得多。
